aircraft.value: Pegasus Swift - AC-1331-132 at Sector South Station

defect_observed.value: Countermeasure dispenser misfire. Malfunction reported by flight crew.

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Weapon Release component. Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.

corrective_action.value: Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme

preventive_action.value: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type

remarks_investigation.value: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.

remarks_design.value: Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions. Date: 24/02/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type. Date: 26/02/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions. Date: 29/02/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions. Date: 01/03/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound. Date: 02/03/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Countermeasure dispenser misfire. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Electromagnetic interference affecting sensor accuracy
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Weapon Release component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type
d) Attributable Code: F - Failure/ageing/Corrosion/Material Failure
